sov, who had come into the room unnoticed by anyone, stood there and wiped his eyes at the sight. 
"Vasili Denfsov, your son's friend," he said, introducing himself to the count, who was looking inquiringly at him. 
"You are most welcome! I know, I know," said the count, kissing and embracing Denisov. "Nicholas wrote us ... Natdsha, Vera, look! Here is Denfsovl"
